column4: hi there... i have a really strange problem here with davfs2...but maybe it is not so much davfs2 related as i thought...
i want to copy files from a davfs2 mounted webdav share to a local folder on my harddrive
mounting and everything worx absolutely flawless
but after a while i get loads of these here:
cp: cannot open `/mnt/webdav/foo/bar/foo/foo bar/foo/foo.bar' for reading: Input/output error
what really seems strange to me is the ` at the beginning....isnt that supposed to be a ' instead ?
cause when i do a cd `/mnt/webdav/foo/bar/foo/foo bar/foo/'
this does not work
any idea is greatly appreciated
does the folder exist?
all the files are there but cant be copied
have you checked the permissions?
ls -al
should do the job shouldnt it
what should do the job?
-rw-r--r--  1 root root
that should work, it should allow for copying
right but it doesnt
well, I don't think you need to use ' or `
well no of course i only do a cp -r /mnt/webdav /usr/local/backup
but in the error i get it has this `
I don't know, sorry
thanx anyways no prob !
